subject.geographic: Corner of Carondelet and Gravier Sts., New Orleans, La

mods.abstract: TEN DOLLARS REWARD. -- Ran away on the 24th of January, 1854, WM. TURNER, a griffe boy, about 12 years of age, 4 feet 4 inches high ; had on, when absconded, Blue Flannel Shirt and Kentucky Jean Pants; has a ascar over his right eye and a down-cast look when spoken to, and is slender built. He formerly belonged to Sumpter Turner, of this city, and is supposed to be secreted in the First District. All persons are cautioned against harboring said slave. The above reward will be paid to any person lodging him in any of the City Jails, or giving information of his whereabouts to Messrs. A. J. WRIGHT & CO., corner of Carondelet and Gravier sts. jan 31 1w*

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
